entry.title: Finding a decent Minecraft launcher
entry.content:
Intro

I don‚Äôt have a Minecraft account because I bought the game in 2011 and lost my account, yet I refuse to buy the game again for twice its original price. Screw you Microsoft I‚Äôm not paying for Bedrock edition.

I‚Äôve been using TLauncher - the ORIGINAL TLauncher - for many years now, but as I switched from PC to PC I ended up with the infamous clone that was accused of being full of spyware not too long ago. I haven‚Äôt played Minecraft in a good while so I didn‚Äôt bother switching clients until a few days ago when I wanted to play for a bit and kept hearing that TLauncher isn‚Äôt safe.

Blindly looking for a cracked Minecraft client that isn‚Äôt full of malware is a difficult task, so I asked for recomendations and tried them all, then I got into the MultiMC forks rabbithole and tried some more.

In particular I was looking for a client to play 1.20.2 with Forge and a few specific mods, and for it to have some sort of skin support. These are the ones I tried, split into the ones I deleted and the ones I kept.

Clients I deleted

MultiMC

This was one I got recommended but it isn‚Äôt cracked so it‚Äôs useless for me. Nearly every client in this list is a fork of this one lmao.

MultiMC website

Salwyrr

According to the website they don‚Äôt have the version I want (it said 1.8.9 - 1.19.2) but I decided to try nonetheless. I downloaded the .jar version and it told me to download the other version. uh. ok i guess.

I installed the .exe one and for some reason it opened up in windowed full screen in my second monitor. Weird. It also didn‚Äôt load so I only had a dark gray window. Re-installed it and it finally worked. I rejected their cookies and opened up the settings but the only two settings are ‚ÄúRAM‚Äù and to modify my cookie preferences. I assume the RAM thing is maximum RAM.

The website was indeed correct and they only had up to version 1.19.2, but I still wanted to try it out so I launched version 1.12.2. It froze for a good while but it did work at the end. The menu and settings is completely revamped to match their dark gray minimalistic theme with iOS emojis, and they had a bunch of Hypixel specific mods and settings that I didn‚Äôt touch. I tried creating a world aaaaand it‚Äôs premium only. Apparently they removed offline accounts in March of this year for legal and partnership reasons.

So to the trash bin it goes.

Salwyrr website

PrismLauncher

MultiMC fork. It‚Äôs not cracked :(

Apparently you can allow offline accounts by modifying the code and compiling it yourself but it‚Äôs a bother and wouldn‚Äôt let me use skins.

PrismLauncher website

Clients I kept

UltimMC

Another MultiMC fork, this one cracked, that allows local and Ely.by accounts.

Everything was perfect with this one but then I tried adding Forge to my 1.20.2 instance and it just wouldn‚Äôt launch. I tried switching to every Java version I have (which are A LOT ngl) and still didn‚Äôt work. Disabling Forge made it able to launch again and I also tried making a 1.12.2 Forge instance and it did work. So I have no clue of what‚Äôs wrong.

Even though it didn‚Äôt work at the end it seems like a puntual error (?) so I‚Äôm keeping it. I opened an issue on its repo so hopefully they‚Äôll fix it.

UltimMC github

PollyMC

A fork of PrismLauncher (and by extension a MultiMC fork) that allows offline accounts and alternative auth servers, like Ely.by or LittleSkin. Getting the alt auth servers to work is a bit trickier than in UltimMC since you need to input the URL of the page you‚Äôre using but it‚Äôs easy enough and explained in the documentation. It also lets you choose a mod loader as you create the instance instead of adding it later, which is nice.

However, unlike UltimMC, this one did manage to launch my beloved 1.20.2 Forge instance. üíû

PollyMC github

SKlauncher

The website is SO SLOW??? Huh????????

After waiting FOREVER to make an account and FOREVER to load my profile to edit it and EVEN MORE FOREVERS for the downloads page to work I finally got it and installed it. Loading also took forever, but that didn‚Äôt bother me as much.

Sometimes it refuses to launch, though. Idk why.

The website has a whole section where you choose your skin and everything, but for some reason the client only lets you login with Microsoft or use an offline account. I thought ‚ÄúWhat? So there‚Äôs no way of having skins? What was that section of the website for then?‚Äù but it turns out that the offline account takes the skin from the SKlauncher account from the website. Without asking for a password. Strange, but the only ‚Äústealable‚Äù thing there is your skin so it doesn‚Äôt matter much.

The client itself has a modern minimalistic look and you can create instances with Forge, Fabric, Quill and everything. It also has a section for downloading modpacks and it seems that individual mod downloading is planned for version 3.3 of the launcher (I‚Äôm using 3.2).

I created the 1.20.2 instance and launched it, it uses the same folder as TLauncher so I was greeted by the mods I already had, which was a nice surprise since that meant that I didn‚Äôt have to move anything.

Overall, it‚Äôs good and it did what I wanted. I wish the program didn‚Äôt give up on loading sometimes, though.

SKlauncher website

Conclusion

The conclusion is that my cheap forgetful ass wouldn‚Äôt have so many problems if it stoped being cheap or forgetful. Since I would have a legal Minecraft account.

Currently I‚Äôm using PollyMC on virtue of it loading faster than SKlauncher, and I‚Äôm making sure that my old TLauncher stuff is in SKlauncher so that I can delete it for good. I‚Äôll probably end up keeping the one with the best skin support or one of the Github ones since they‚Äôre FOSS.

entry.title: Hello world
entry.content:

Lists

Unordered

This is an unordered list:

  • First item on the list
    • Indented list
    • Same list
      • Whoops
  • This one goes after the indented list
  • Fin

Ordered

  1. Ordered list
  2. Second item
    1. Indented
      1. Super indented
  3. Last item

Embeds

Here‚Äôs a youtube embed

Here‚Äôs a tumblr embed

https://nynasunner.tumblr.com/post/698444298515021824

Here‚Äôs a twitter embed

This one has made me laugh for YEARS https://t.co/ecjSne9J8z pic.twitter.com/SehgNnTKPo

— Heli üåô (@LunarRavana) June 3, 2023

Other stuff

Still trying to figure out how to change the color of a disabled textbox without making another textbox and hiding the original

  • Check
  • Checkn‚Äôt

I wanted my emojis to look the same across all platforms so I included twemoji! üòä Though the way I‚Äôm implementing them might make the page slow down üòî If only the twemoji gem worked in GH Pages‚Ä¶ ü•∫

A term
its definition?
I‚Äôm not really sure of what this is

You can click on images to view them in a new tab. If the image comes from an specific source (like a twitter post) clicking on it will lead you to said post instead

This is a blockquote! Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, did you know that fish only have two heart chambers? That means that the blood flows through all of the body before being pumped by the heart again, unlike in us mammals where the blood is pumped twice per cycle

:O

Here‚Äôs a bit of code teehee

Fenced codeblock with no format

{
  "firstName": "John",
  "lastName": "Smith",
  "age": 25
}

Fenced codeblock with format, using the dark monokai theme because it‚Äôs the best

<div class="example">
	<p>Waow, an example</p>
</div>

Here‚Äôs a sentence with a footnote1.

Idk how I want to style tables yet

Syntax Description
Header Title
Paragraph Text

For the icons I‚Äôm using simpleicons! Like this:

If you‚Äôre on PC you‚Äôll see a sidebar on the right that indicates on what part of the post you‚Äôre at. It disappears if your screen isn‚Äôt wide enough so it isn‚Äôt visible on mobile

This is the end of the post! Below is the footnote and a Disqus comment section. I don‚Äôt like Disqus and I‚Äôve tried disabling its ads but it was the only free comment section that didn‚Äôt force you to log in even to leave anonymous messages (like Commentbox)

  1. This is the footnote!¬†↩
